result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Will J Thomas

records.addlTxt:
11:18 AM Defendant Will J Thomas in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Will J Thomas.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case was set for hearing. Defense requests plea and sentencing, but State is unable to proceed due to compliance with victim's rights. 
Court sets a separate plea and sentencing date.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 08/25/2022.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant to have no contact with co defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms. Defendant to have no contact with co defendants listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

3:26 PM Defendant Will J Thomas in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Erik Schlueter. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Case recalled at 3:41 District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marruto. State Public Defender's Office Law Intern appeared for the defense by Erik Schlueter.  Defendant not appearing.  Court modified bail conditions and set a new date.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
